A parallel opportunity is that the company could get sold. There has been a lot of consolidation in the medtech space and Lampropoulos is at an age, 70, where he might start thinking about an exit. Following feedback from soldiers, Fort Wainwright implements quality of life improvements ...  soldiers just to touch and do the maintenance on the vehicles, ya know it's for their safety, not to get frost bite," said Rangelfalu. Once the eight maintenance winter facilities are constructed, the battalions will be able to house one third of their vehicles inside. "The morale for the soldiers will be a lot higher due to the fact that they don't have to stand above the Stryker and shovel off all the snow, which is time consuming. It is going to build up the morale for them to just get in there, get the job done as quick as possible and as safe as possible," said Rangelfalu. He says the goal is to keep the facilities up to 40 degrees to keep the vehicles ready for maintenance. The soldiers will be able to stay covered and warm while ...

Born in 1971, Arbovitz earned a degree in engineering at the University of Miami and in 2004 founded MAKO Surgical Corp, a company that manufactured surgical robotic arm assistance platforms. In 2013, MAKO was sold to Stryker Corp. for $1.65 billion. Arbovitz says he founded Magic Leap in his garage with the goal of "redefining" the future of computing, Innovation in west Broward In 2015, Magic Leap opened a new headquarters in Plantation amid fanfare from employees from South Florida, elsewhere around the U.S. and overseas. KROQ DJ Anthony Valadez talks Latin alternative radio show and performing for Prince ...  be right, but I also want it to matter. Latin alternative music is so wide and I'm trying to make everyone happy, but really, the first show was amazing." Valadez is spinning songs in English and Spanish by a variety of Latin artists, from up-and-coming acts to award-winning bands. Valadez, much like legendary former KROQ DJ Rodney Bingenheimer and current morning show co-host Ted Stryker , already has gotten the rush of playing music that matters to his audience. In this case, it was Los Angeles-based Latino ska band The Steady 45s. "One of the things that made me feel really good was somebody did an Instagram story where she was listening to the show and she knew one of the bands," Valadez said of a Steady 45s fan. "She was like, ' ...
